articles.title: Breaking Bad Star Raymond Cruz Arrested After Hose Incident
articles.summary: Actor **Raymond Cruz**, known for playing Tuco in **Breaking Bad**, was arrested **Monday morning** for allegedly spraying multiple women with a water hose. The **Scottsdale** police charged him with **battery** but released him without bail. The incident details and motivations remain unclear.

articles.title: Lachlan Murdoch Wins Control of Fox Media Empire
articles.summary: **Lachlan Murdoch** has secured control of the **Fox Corporation** empire after litigation ended between family members. His father **Rupert**, aged **94**, had attempted to change the family trust but failed. The deal resolves the succession battle for the global media conglomerate worth billions.

articles.title: Trump's Net Worth Surges Three Billion in One Year
articles.summary: **Donald Trump's** net worth increased by **$3 billion** over the past year due to his presidency, jumping **118 spots** on the **Forbes 400** list. After falling off the prestigious ranking in **2023**, his improved political prospects have dramatically boosted his financial standing.

articles.title: Nepal Police Kill Nineteen Gen Z Protesters in Deadly Crackdown
articles.summary: **Nepal** police opened fire on unarmed **Gen Z** protesters **Monday**, killing at least **19** students. The deadly crackdown escalated a crisis that began with a **social media ban** and protests against government corruption. The violence marks Nepal's deadliest protest suppression in years.

articles.title: Chinese Robot Maker Unitree Targets Seven Billion Dollar IPO
articles.summary: **China's Unitree Robotics** is planning an initial public offering with a **$7 billion** valuation (**50 billion yuan**). The **Zhejiang**-based startup has emerged as a leader in **humanoid robots** powered by artificial intelligence, competing globally in industrial and service sector applications.

articles.title: Europe's AI Champion Mistral Secures Massive ASML Investment
articles.summary: French AI startup **Mistral** received **$1.5 billion** (**1.3 billion euros**) from Dutch chip giant **ASML** as part of a **$2 billion** funding round. **ASML**, valued at **$308 billion**, now owns approximately **11%** of Mistral, becoming its largest shareholder.

articles.title: Winklevoss Twins Take Gemini Crypto Exchange Public on Nasdaq
articles.summary: **Gemini** cryptocurrency exchange, founded by **Tyler** and **Cameron Winklevoss**, is heading to **Nasdaq** with a **$2.1 billion** valuation. The twins are betting on crypto's next chapter as the exchange goes public, marking a significant milestone for the digital asset industry.

articles.title: Trump Administration Attacks Climate Science Weakening US Preparedness
articles.summary: President **Donald Trump's** Environmental Protection Agency announced a proposal in **late July** to reverse climate policies previously deemed essential. The administration's war on climate science affects **NOAA's** hurricane predictions and environmental protections, potentially weakening America's ability to respond to extreme weather events.

articles.title: FDA Approves Human Trials for Pig Kidney Transplants
articles.summary: The **FDA** has approved human trials for **xenotransplants** using **pig kidneys** in patients. This breakthrough allows scientists to study longer-term organ viability in humans. The approval represents a major leap forward in addressing the critical shortage of transplantable organs nationwide.

articles.title: India Challenges BRICS Partners Over Growing Trade Deficits
articles.summary: **India's** External Affairs Minister **S. Jaishankar** urged **BRICS** members to address trade imbalances at a **Monday** virtual summit. He stated India's biggest trade deficits are with BRICS partners, while **China** called for unity against **Trump's** tariffs affecting global trade.

dailyGreeting: Good morning! Media empires and protests shake today's headlines.

historicalEvents.description: Continental Congress officially names country 'United States of America'
North Korea established as communist state under Kim Il-sung
Ahmad Shah Massoud assassinated by Al-Qaeda suicide bombers
